page.title: 07 MIDDLE AND UPPER MARKETS
page.content: The Middle market is the selling area for{fat stock cattle}bred for beef. There are Charolais,Devon,Jersey, Friesian and Hereford cows.It is not the same{auctioneer}who sells every week.The cattle arrive in{lorries they are unloaded,weighed,auctioned, penned and loaded by drovers on to the buyers' lorries.In the upper market calves and pigs are sold.The month old {calves}are sold for about Â£150 and fetch a good price because in the summer there is plenty of milk to feed them.{Pigs,}about eight weeks old, are mainly White Saddle Backs and are sold for fattening.In June the market is not very busy because farmers are busy with silage and hay_making.50 years ago the animals were driven to market and made the streets very messy.Now after every market it is hosed down.
